alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 13 at 7:30PM CDT until March 25 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting West Feliciana, East Baton Rouge and Pointe Coupee Parishes. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, MARCH 25... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Red River Landing. * WHEN...Until Saturday, March 25. * IMPACTS...At 51.0 feet, All river islands along the reach from Red River Landing to Baton Rouge will be inundated. Recreational camps and river bottom farm land will be under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 49.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 50.5 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, March 24. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.5 feet on 04/15/1874. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana
